snippet: With its paths and cloak of dense vegetation, the Ramble in Central Park has long been known as a place where people prowl for anonymous sexual encounters, but the same elements have made it a magnet for bird-watchers.
abstract: Ramble in Central Park, with its serpentine paths and dense vegetation, has long been known as a place where people prowl for anonymous sexual encounters, but those same elements have made it a magnet for bird-watchers; divergent worlds collide when a 73-year-old woman photographing birds is sexually assaulted by a man with whom she had recently had an unpleasant encounter in the Ramble.

byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum, Emily S. Rueb and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With its paths and cloak of dense vegetation, the Ramble in Central Park has long been known as a place where people prowl for anonymous sexual encounters, but the same elements have made it a magnet for bird-watchers.

headline.seo: In Central Park, an Uneasy Coexistence Grows Uneasier
headline.main: In Central Park, a Birders’ Secluded Haven Comes With a Dark Side
headline.print_headline: A Birders’ Secluded Haven Comes With a Dark Side
